node.title: Common sleep disorder linked to greater risk of death from COVID-19
node.description: The risk of severe illness from COVID-19 is higher in people with this condition, a new study has found.
node.content: ["The risk of severe illness from COVID-19 is higher in people with obstructive sleep apnea and other breathing problems that cause oxygen levels to drop during sleep, researchers say.\u00a0", "They tracked 5402 adults with these problems and found that roughly a third of them eventually tested posted for the coronavirus.\u00a0", "While periodic episodes of not-breathing while asleep - leading to low oxygen levels, or hypoxia - did not increase people's chances of being infected, sleep-related hypoxia did increase infected patients' odds of needing to be hospitalised or dying from COVID-19, Dr Cinthya Pena Orbea and Dr Reena Mehra of the Cleveland Clinic and colleagues reported on Wednesday in JAMA Network Open.\u00a0", "It is not clear if treatments that improve sleep apnea, such as CPAP machines that push air into patients' airways during sleep, would also reduce the risk of severe COVID-19, said Pena Orbea and Mehra.", "Reuters", "\u00a0"]
